And it was affordable, working as a federal employee and not getting a pay raise in 3 years has taken it toll on eveybody's checkbook.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Joely
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my ipad, ive had it for about 2 years now and never had a problem with it .

Reviews.Title: I'm in love
Reviews.Author: wildchild
Reviews.Content: I still don't understand how to use it and I got it for school and the text books I can get on it.  But there are other things I can do with it as well as I learn it more and more.  My Dictionary app I think it my favorite one with being in college again.  I am just having so much fun with it even if I am not that technologically smart....

Reviews.Title: Better than I Expected
Reviews.Author: Cornelius
Reviews.Content: I choose this rating because I was kind of skeptical about the arrival of the product. I was in very good condition the battery was fully charged and rapped for maximum protection.

Reviews.Title: Amazing iPad!!! I'M A BELIEVER!!!!
Reviews.Author: NEXT!
Reviews.Content: Before I couldn't fathom spending $300 on a micro computer. What was the big deal??? I have a laptop, so it's the same damn thing, right? WRONG!!! I bought this for my BF and haven't let him touch it yet! I swear I'll give it to him when he has internet at his apartment, but until then...HE'S MINE!!! Amazing apps, speed is wonderful...when I finally relinquish his gift, I'll buy my own.

Reviews.Title: Not pleased with order
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: On the delievery of the purchase their were items missing with the order.I was missing a charger and the UVS cable which made it impossible for me  charge or use my I-Pad. I was told the items would be sent to me and here it is a month later and still no cable or charger has been mailed.

Reviews.Title: Used iPad 1st generation
Reviews.Author: obxbum
Reviews.Content: This product was in excellent shape and I received it in a very timely manner. This transaction has made me much more willing to buy used electronics. I would highly recommend this seller. The transaction was simple and easy and the iPad arrived exactly as promised and in better condition than I ever dreamed. It was purchased as a 75th birthday present for my mother. She was thrilled with it and has loved using it. She has adapted very quickly to the Apple format and is recommending iPad's to all of her friends. Thanks for an awesome experience from a previously skeptical consumer!

Reviews.Title: Great technology for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We bought this iPad from the Amazon wear house. Our kids wanted iPod's but we wanted something larger that the whole family could use. It's easy to use. Lots of free apps. All 3 of our children (3,5, and8 yr old) enjoy playing on it. It surfs the Internet faster than our new pc lab top.

Reviews.Title: I love this IPad
Reviews.Author: Paradise
Reviews.Content: This seller was extremely fast and gave immediate feedback when the delivery would be. Received this item in less than a week.This used IPad is like it's brand new. I cannot put into words how satisfied I am. This was bought for my wife but I ended up being the one who uses it the most. I would say to anyone who is cautious about buying used, don't be, just be sure you get a product that is like new. Pay an extra $50 dollars or so to get a product that is like new but used. I buy used all the time from Amazon and have always been satisfied and knowing Amazon is on your side is also a good thing...

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!  Love it!
Reviews.Author: momtoamiracle
Reviews.Content: I got my Like New first generation 32GB ipad yesterday. What a deal!  It looks brand new and works flawlessly.  It is my first tablet, I don't even have an iphone, but I've gotten used to it already. Very easy to use and download my music, books, and documents. Very very nice item. If you've been wanting one, take the opportunity to get it. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Should have had a camera from the get-go
Reviews.Author: Shelley Gammon "Geek"
Reviews.Content: I've had the original iPad for about a year and a half and have really enjoyed the increasing levels of functionality with each new iOS release. My only disappointment was that this model did not have a camera. When a cheaper product, the iPod Touch had a camera, there was no reason not to include one in this model. There are so many iPad-only apps that require the use of a camera that I'd like to use - and I can't use them on my iPhone. While I think the iPad is an awkward point-n-shoot camera due to its size, there have been a number of times I've been reading an iBook during lunch and I wanted to take a photo of something and had to claw around looking for my iPhone to do that. The ample screen size makes reading books (whether they are PDFs, iBooks or Kindle books via the Kindle App) very easy on the eyes. Even though I don't have a retina display on this original iPad, the text still looks nice and it is very readable.

Reviews.Title: Best ever
Reviews.Author: roxyfoxy33
Reviews.Content: Great product got here fast  super clean no damage I'm addicted to this iPad it's better than my kindle fire

Reviews.Title: This item had been USED and was advertised as NEW.  APPLE had it registered to another user.  DO NOT BUY FROM THIS SELLER!
Reviews.Author: D. Wensel
Reviews.Content: We have never been able to get it to work.  We have Wifi at home because we have IMac computer.  I bought this early for my boyfriends birthday, and was assured that it was new.  The seller told me that he had to register it in order to upgrade it.  Well ... the battery won't even charge more than 40% .  We have been advised by my boyfriends IT employee, to take it to Apple and explain the situation and perhaps Apple will (but certainly doesn't have to, it wasn't their fault) give us a new one.  Yeah, right.  I paid $500.00 for this USED  IPad.

Reviews.Title: Won't access much of the web
Reviews.Author: Marge OConnor
Reviews.Content: If you're buying this to surf, forget it!  It has no Flash Player, and they refuse to give it to iPad owners, so you can't access any site that uses Flash Player. And more and more sites are using it. I can't tell you how frustrating it is to open site after site and get a message saying "This site requires Flash Player.  Download it here.". And you try to download it and can't because it's not allowed in the iPad or iPhone. If I'd known about this frustration level I'd never have bought the iPad. I'd have bought a droid which seems to have no trouble with Flash.  Shame on Apple!

Reviews.Title: Why buy here?  Go with Apple refurb instead!
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I love the iPad but the prices shown here are very high.  Instead, go to Apple's online store and pick up a refurbished model with a new battery, new outer shell AND a 1-year warranty for much less.  They're fully checked out so I don't see where you would go wrong, except to overpay for one from these vendors.  Just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Best tech toy of 2010-2011
Reviews.Author: Member "Spyder"
Reviews.Content: Already so much said about it that there isn't much room for any addition on my behalf .Its solid product better features then Nook and kindle but pricer then both .If Apple had introduced camera kit for first gen ipad that could be awesome but they didn't. Its the only negative i can say about ipad ..Thanks to Steve for keeping same price for both gen .For time being its just about availability .i chosen old gen because newer is still out of stock in store and older is cheaper now.

Reviews.Title: It's Apple...what do you expect?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The iPad is amazing. It's the perfect tablet and can do virtually anything you want it to. it's a great productive tool when you're on the go and a nice little handheld gaming device when you want to kill some time. I got the 16GB, Wifi, #G version but apparently third parties don't send the iPad with a Micro sim card. So that left the 3G part useless to me. Luckily, i havn't needed it yet, but i do know that when I do need it, i will be pretty mad...

Reviews.Title: It's Useful - It's FUN!
Reviews.Author: Jean1960 "Jean"
Reviews.Content: I won't go into detail about the technical features because many others have already described that here, but just want to say that I love it my iPad!!! I was worried I would not use it enough so that's why I put off buying one, but I've used it every day! I would say "go for it" to anyone who is hesitating to get a iPad because they think they won't use it. I was one of those people. Now I use it in the evening while my hubby is watching tv. I use it to watch movies in bed at night when I can't sleep. I listen to music or radio channels when I clean house. I do online research it's so much faster to turn on and to get online than turning on my pc. I use it to read my Kindle books at night because it has a backlight. I use it when I'm waiting at the airport or at the doctors office.The abundance of apps was the main reason I decided to go with the iPad instead of the Galaxy or another tablet. I am not technologically savvy, but using the iPad has been super easy. So far I've installed apps for Kindle books, iBooks, local radio stations, Netflix movies, lots of free games (like scrabble, solitare, NYT crosswords, tetris), photography, calenders, notes, journals, ebay, etc.I will still use my Kindle for the majority of reading since it's much easier on my eyes. My eyes get a little sore/dry/blurry using the iPad after a couple of hours (just like on staring at a computer screen.) It's ok as long as I remember to take breaks (my age is showing) but usually I'm having so much fun on the iPad that time gets away from me!I was worried the wifi would be slow at my house, but it has been pretty fast. There has been no lag time at all watching Netflix movies.Have fun with your iPad - I sure am!!!

Reviews.Title: iPad, Gen 1
Reviews.Author: Howard
Reviews.Content: I'm very satisfied with the iPad.  It arrived in the condition as described by the seller; like new.  I'm glad that I bought it through Amazon; good savings on a great product!

Reviews.Title: Arrived in good condition and works well
Reviews.Author: H. Black
Reviews.Content: Didn't want to spend the extra money for an iPad 2 - just to get a (poor quality) camera and extra speed so ordered this.Arrived in good condition - no screen protector on it, but the glass was not scratched or anything.Had to remove references to accounts from previous owner (surprised by this since the first used iPad I purchased was wiped clean prior to my getting it). Still I have no complaints - I also did not need to install the OS as I would have with a totally cleaned machine.Works well and arrived in the advertised condition.

Reviews.Title: cool product
Reviews.Author: Va. reviewer
Reviews.Content: I am coming to love my iPad. I did have to go buy "iPad for Dummies" but that is Apple's problem. It should be a recommended "extra" for beginning iPad users.

Reviews.Title: Very useful
Reviews.Author: CodyStevens
Reviews.Content: The iPad is probably the most useful item I own ...I can type my essays on it check my grades and read when ever I want. I'm very happy I bought this. And I've had no problems with it ....at all!

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: Scottie35
Reviews.Content: fantastic seller, great product, super fast shipping... don't settle for a cheap knock off it's not worth the hassle ..

Reviews.Title: Amazon Price
Reviews.Author: David Perrine
Reviews.Content: I'm wondering how Amazon can charge $947 for this item. It is only $849 on the Apple website. I was under the impression that Apple controlled the vendor prices. Anyway, for a better deal, go directly to Apple and purchase this.

Reviews.Title: amazing!!
Reviews.Author: Helo
Reviews.Content: Ipad its simply the best device from Apple. And it much more than fun. Its a powerful device to work. Many apps turns it to a desktop! Buy a 64GB ipad

Reviews.Title: Money well spent
Reviews.Author: Katie58
Reviews.Content: I have owned my 32gig wifi iPad for about 3 months.  I don't believe there has been a day where I haven't used it.  Saying that I can't live without this product would be a bit much, but I can say I wouldn't want to.  I use it for many purposes, but mainly entertainment.  Movies are gorgeous on the screen, games are great and there are some games with incredible graphics that look amazing. I can't compare it to a kindle, cause I never used one, but in can say reading is great on the iPad.  The screen makes it so you can read in the dark, on the flip side, you can't really take it outside in the sun unless you get a shaded area, even then it's kinda hard to see the screen.I've seen a lot of reviews saying it's a bigger iPod touch, which it is, but that's what I love about it.  I owned the iPod touch for  about a week and sent it back cause I didn't find it that great.  When the iPad came out I thought it looked perfect because the size is perfect.It's a bit on the pricey side, but well worth it.  If you have the money, get this thing.

Reviews.Title: No flash or bluetooth DUN.  Unforgivable...
Reviews.Author: Tech Blog Tv
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong.  I like my iPad.  My biggest use for it is having on my lap while I watch TV.  Not including flash capability is really the only thing wrong with it.  I can run flash on my netbook and cell phone fine but not on my $500 tablet?!?!??!?  It's so annoying to surf into a site that uses flash.  I usually end up putting the iPad down to go to my main computer.The other thing that sucks is the connectivity options.  There's absolutely no reason why the iPad can't have bluetooth dial up networking with my cell phone.  Netbooks at half the price can do this but not the iPad?  Are you kidding me Steve?!?!?!

Reviews.Title: Needs more features for that price...
Reviews.Author: SBHM
Reviews.Content: The iPad is an impressive devise if you just want to use it like an iPot touch, but it really needs from my point of view:- Folders to store files that can be directly accessed or by different apps - the same way as it is right now for the photos- Want to transfer files from my computer while connecting to computer by using the cable- Want to have access to folders to organize files and folders from computer to match content and documents I am carrying with me (I do not want to have everything in the cloud)- USB port to connect directly to printer and digital cameraI hope the next iPad will have those features to make it more usable as a travel computer. Without those, this is not realy a portable computer.

Reviews.Title: I Love My iPad
Reviews.Author: T. Mardall
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the unfortunate name,  I love my iPad. All of the software that I've bought or downloaded for free works great. It hasn't frozen, or even slowed down once. I've already written two multi-page papers using Apple's Pages program and the onscreen keyboard, which is surprisingly easy to use. While writing a paper and doing research online, interspersed with playing several games, watching a NetFlix movie and checking my email, I got a full 11.5 hours out of the battery without having to plug it in. It's light, easy to carry, great around the house and outside.  I've already gotten rid of my pocket pc and my GPS, and haven't had to power up my laptop since I got it.  Now here's the real kicker, my somewhat elderly mother, who is technologically challenged, even likes to use it, she went and ordered one, saying that it is so much easier to use then her laptop and iPod. ( She checks email and cruises the internet on her laptop, and thinks the larger screen is much easier to see then her iPod )I recommend this to any and all.  This really is a great device.

Reviews.Title: It's Just Okay...and a Toy
Reviews.Author: Stephen Gyves "The Elvenking"
Reviews.Content: Okay...let's get this out of the way right off before I get a bit more detailed. NO FLASH = GIMPED INTERNET......PERIOD!Okay...now that's out of the way..on to my impressions of this silly gadget. (Oops...revealing a bit too much early..but hey).So I get (have) to use one of these things for absolutely zero cost for the company I work for. We develop an application for this thing so I have to have one to test on this platform. I was happy that I would get to test drive one for free and then....poof...nothing. I have it sitting here right next to me as I use a real machine that I will not brand as PC or Mac for public notice (it does't matter..both are superior). It just doesn't do anything that my smartphone or a laptop doesn't do infintely better. Now I have to admit that I am a power user of my devices and demand a bit more control and that may have me a bit biased. However, it gives no excuse to the dilusional marketing aimed at this device by Apple.Let's get going with the reality. Say you spend 600 bucks on one of these things. From that point on...yer going to put use to this thing...or consider your money wasted. So...if you are to wrap your head around one of those options...it is going to be to justify your purchase no matter how silly...because you don't want to look foolish. That, I think is the case with the iPad. It's just not mature, and it has its place as a toy at this moment.Then there is Apple's customer-unfriendly way of charging for stuff that should be free. Ohh the App store. I could go on for hours about that. About how Apple locks you into using their tools to operate their hardware and it's all Apple...Apple..APPLE. Marketing..marketing...all things Apple. Use our app to get your music on our device. All else causes problems. There is just no variety with these devices and I despise that. Feels like you never really own the device you purchased. Just a lease with Apples conditions. With my droid phone....I can remote into my home PC and manage everything that a home PC can do. (And I have Flash...gonna be a running theme there...sorry. Jobs is a pompus a**)I think it is time to clear one other thing up in this review just so it's fair. There are two types of products, those that are easy to use, and limit flexibility...and those that are extremely flexible...but you must become an expert to flex that power. And all those in between. If you are looking for an easy way to do things, not critical about content, and quite willing to pay for solutions as opposed to figuring something out...maybe this is for you. Ignore my review...all the way.  I am just here to put this device in its place. If you have the money to spend on this thing for gimped couch surfing..awesome...enjoy. I will be on something that renders falsh at the moment. (Sorry...there goes another Flash dig...but Jobs...YOU DESERVE IT!)Let's talk screen resolution. EXACTLY THE SAME AS THE IPHONE. So all you get for your screen size increase is BIGGER PIXELS! (Leaset as far as I can tell..I can see the blocks) So maybe it makes it a bit more useable for the blind and fat fingered...but no real improvement.Bottom Line...call me when I can do work with this thing. I have to say...that all Microsoft has to do is do the same thing and give it a purpose..and Apple loses again. They have a lot of fans for this toy..no doubt. I will admit...millions of people cannot be wrong and it is only a matter of time before someone does this tablet computer right and the rest of us are holding something similar. However, most of Apples commercials and quotes promoting this device are grandiose and dilusional. Making music on this thing????? LMAO...maybe for the kids. Yes...that is what this is...a great KIDS toy. Maybe that is it....I am just expection seriousness from a line of hardware that was meant for FUN. In that case, they hit the mark...bravo Apple. Showing slide shows to the family...browsing a book, maybe a netflix stram in a pinch...but to me there are just no such pinches. I have solutions for all thsoe things already..and they do not let me down.Okay...okay...let's not make it totally bad. After all you can watch movies on it in bed (or you could get a TV for your room)...surf the internet from your couch  and play smurf villiage which I heard is absolutely ADDICTIVE. On the more serious side, you can get books and read in a beautiful format which I find very pleasent. One thing I found magnificaent about this device is it's place in the education system. Man could you do away with the books and such. For that..it's awesome..but that has to be your use of the device. However, remember...paying 600 dollars to make this thing have a purpose in your life is a bit much. So you better have it's purpose worked out for you, or you'll end up justifying its cost by working it into your life..Okay...so on to another phase. Here I sit...at home..with my first access to an iPad...and I want nothing to do with it. Why? Because every other device I have will play flash! (Ahh man the Flash thing again...darn it!) How can you have any internet enabled device and not have FLASH. Steve Jobs...you are a foolish idiot and will damned well pay for it. Sure HTML 5 is coming our way....but the CURRENT internet is not gonna be rid of flash for a LONG time you friggin DOPE! (Still talking to Jobs...sorry)My last comment to sum up is this. If yer looking to buy an iPad...don't be serious...and you'll be fine. Cheers.Final thought...I would rather be a PC user...using a tool...than a tool..using an iPad. BAM!

Reviews.Title: Quality product
Reviews.Author: Thomas Wolf
Reviews.Content: I bought my wife the iPad for her birthday a few months ago, and she's very happy with it.  However, she mostly uses it to watch Chinese YouTube videos and to surf a small set of web sites.  She occasionally uses the built-in apps (NYTimes, ABCnews, etc.)  Again, she's very happy with it in this limited capacity.We're also both very happy with the build quality and the fact that it works just like our iPhones - so the learning curve is 0.Where the iPad really falls down is when you want to (or have to!) visit web sites that use Adobe Flash.  No matter what Steve Jobs says about Flash (it being a battery hog, etc.) he did his customers an extreme disservice not giving *them* the choice.  His claim that only a small part of the Web uses Flash is pretty much a lie.  Just try to visit any commercial site that attempts to show its customers 360degree views of its products - none of them display with the iPad.  We're not talking minor web sites - try [...] (you can't even see their main page with the iPad because it's *entirely* flash based), volvo.com, honda.com, toyota.com.  Many games web sites use Adobe Flash for their games - again, none of them display on the iPad (I won't even go into the iPad's inability to display Java - forget about all the web sites that use it for games, or other content).And there's pretty much no chance that Steve Jobs will ever change his mind with regards to supporting Adobe Flash on either the iPad or the iPhone or the iPod Touch.  He simply decided that you should not have a choice in this matter.So while we enjoy the iPad for what it does, I can't give it 5 stars - because it is unable to browse a large swath of the Internet.If you want to be able to browse *all* Web pages with a tablet, you're better off getting an Android 2.2 (or above) based tablet - such as the Samsung Galaxy and a slew of other forthcoming tablets.  They all support Flash.-------------Update (Feb. 1, 2013): It's now three years later and Apple still doesn't support Flash.  But, guess what?  IT NO LONGER MATTERS!  Most web sites have moved their content to HTML 5.  We've moved on from from our original iPad to the iPad Retina, and from there to the iPad Air.  And we've been deliriously happy with all of them!  An added benefit of buying Apple products: you get a decent trade-in value!  Each time we traded in our old iPads (by the way Amazon has a great trade-in program for iOS devices), we've gotten at least two hundred dollars.  The competition gets you next to nothing in trade-in (I know - I bought my parents a Kindle HDX 8.9" a bit over a year ago - that's already only worth $90 - on Amazon's own trade-in store!)So I'm upgrading the iPad review to 5 stars.  Flash is simply no longer an issue.

Reviews.Title: Future of computing in your hand
Reviews.Author: volodoscope "Artist by heart, geek by nature"
Reviews.Content: I've been using my iPad for past 6 months and to be honest I use it more than I use any notebook. This is the best thing that Apple has made in a long time. It's super easy to use, (if my mom can use it, anyone can) great battery life, amazing apps and games and nice look and feel to it.The future of computing will definitely not support mouse or traditional screens and interfaces. The future is easy to use touch screen programs that connect to everything around you. iPad is that fist step in that direction.Great product!

Reviews.Title: The iPad 3G will change your world for the better,
Reviews.Author: Porfie Medina "Porfie Jr. Medina"
Reviews.Content: I have had the Ipad 64g 3G for a little over two week and I'm still just as addicted to it as I was the first day. I was familiar with most of the features because I have the Ipod Touch and iPhone 3G. With the Ipad 3G you get the best internet experience on any mobile device period. Of course what would the Ipad be without the actual Ipod which plays music, video, and podcasts. You get wifi plus 3G which means you can use your iPad anywhere besides wifi spots courtesy of At&t.; The price of their data plans for the ipad are very affordable when compared to most other data services. The 3G models have GPS for location-based services, which means you get more accurate directions than the wifi only version. The App Store turns your Ipad in to a entertainment powerhouse. With the app store you can add apps that fit your needs. From games to business you're bound to find something that you will like. You get an amazing book reader with the ibook store, and if you download the amazon kindle app you get another great ebook reader app with many more books to choose from. It is still kind of bizarre to think I can watch a movie, listen to music, surf the internet, play games, read a book, write and read email, get GPS directions, watch you tube videos, check the weather, and even use the iPad as a phone over wifi with the Skype app. My favorite iPad apps are Netflix, abc player, pandora, Amazon kindle app, shazam and a few others. The apple iPad 3g is truly magical and is light years ahead of the competition with its ease of use and versatility. Sure there are things that can be improved (add a camera, add more internal memory and support adobe flash), but that's with anything. When apple finally releases it's update for iPad this fall which will include the ability to multitask (among many other cool features) it will bring a whole new functionality in to the iPad. I cant wait to be able to listen to pandora in the background while i surf the net or read a book. Like it or not the iPad is a revolution and created a whole new device category and will do for tablets what the ipod and iphone did for mp3 players and cell phones.

Reviews.Title: Best "tablet" by FAR...
Reviews.Author: Jacob Phanuef "jgphaneuf"
Reviews.Content: There are many things about this that I would LOVE to change but this is the best tablet out there right now even though it isnt perfect it does what its supposed to do and it does it well.I got mine the first day it came out I was 6th in line ..It can be VERY awkward to hold .. that is probably the biggest complaint that I have about it.apple tries to "revolutionize" EVERYTHING and they always forget .. or just do not include the simple things that the cheap crappy tablets have which can be very annoying and a turn off in many cases.the lack of flash IS NOT A BIG DEAL .. flash was designed and ment for a use with a mouse, ex. "mouseclick, mouserelease, mousehover" flash is not needed and does not play nice with touch screens .. html5 is amazing and works 100 times better then flash would ever work on a tablet.many apps are very useful but with the devs having a limited use of api's and not being able to use private api's and the fact that ios is not open source gets annoying .. in which jailbreaking can come in handy .. but does not have a wide or as well trained devs and does not make as much money .. but all in all the ipad is great and will probly be only getting better and betterDO NOT GET THIS IF you want it just for a ebook reader , the kindle is much better for that, if you want it for a combo book reader and cus its amazing then you should get it but for just reading books get the kindle you will be much happier.

Reviews.Title: Apple iPad
Reviews.Author: Bart Reagan
Reviews.Content: Having purchased the Apple iPad I am very satisfied with the purchase. As soon as Apple gets off of their horse and uploads the version 4 firmware to allow multitasking I will be more happy.Also a few things the iPad needs are a camera, a USB port (or two) to add storage then it will be almost perfect.

Reviews.Title: What I Think of the iPad
Reviews.Author: Ladybug
Reviews.Content: I've decided to tell you my thoughts on the iPad instead of listing technical specifications. Those are available on the Apple website.Physical and Visual Attributes (Snobby sounding, huh? Maybe the statistics that say most iPad owners are stuck up are right...)Firstly, it's just a big black and silver rectangle. It's not really what I would call beautiful, but it is pleasing to look at. Oh, who am I kidding! It's beautiful! Uhem.The brushed silver back is nice. It doesn't show fingerprints or scratches as much as the chrome or plastic that backs most portable Apple products. It's also cool to the touch, which I like.It isn't too heavy to hold, but it's going to be set on my lap most of the time anyway.iPod, Videos, and Photos (or, to go in chronological order, Photos, Videos, and iPod)The Photos app is actually incredibly nifty! When you open it up, granted you have put pictures on it, you're greeted with folders. Each one looks like a couple pictures laid out on a table.You can peak into one of them by pinching slightly or open one of them by pinching a lot. This is awesome and has to be seen to be fully appreciated. If you're not a fan of pinching, you can also just tap on a folder to open it right up.There are a few other interesting things that you can do with this app, but mostly it's for viewing all of your captured memories. Flicking from one picture to the next is fast and smooth.I really like the new look of the Videos app. It's much more...muchier. The bigger view of the DVD and TV show covers and the effect that happens when you click the play icon are both great. Oh, and I love watching stuff on the big screen!The iPod is a lot like iTunes. Instead of cover flow, there is a grid view of your music library. Other than that, everything is pretty much the same.Web Browsing and YouTubeAll of the people out there that don't like the iPad wish that Safari could view flash. That honestly hasn't been a problem for me, but maybe that's just because I don't make a habit of viewing flash-intensive websites.I think browsing the web on an iPad is supercalifragilisticexpialidocious!  Sliding your finger to scroll down a page and tapping or pinching to zoom both feel really natural.  I'm really happy that it doesn't take long to load pages and that I don't have to zoom much.YouTubeAs I've said before, the big screen on the iPad makes watching stuff really enjoyable.  The YouTube app adds tons of videos to it without taking up much space at all.  (Yes, I actually got a 1,000...GB iPad!)Using the app feels like you're on the actual website, but at the same time much better.  The quality of the videos are great, and searching for a particular one is...fun.That's one thing I think is really cool about Apple's gadgets.  They make doing everything fun!  How do they do that?GamingPlants Vs. Zombies HD is the best game app there is! Alright, now that I've got that out of my system, let's me just say that playing games on the iPad is a blast!Racing on it is like having a Wii in your hands.  However, I don't think the iPad could replace a Wii or DS.  Apps can really add up, so make sure you watch how much money you spend on them.Mail and KeyboardThe Mail app that's on the iPad is much more better than the one that's on the iPhone and iPod touch.  In portrait mode you see one of your e-mails, and in landscape mode you see a split screen view of one of your e-mails and a list of any others you've gotten.When you want to compose an e-mail, all you have to do is tap on an icon in the upper right hand corner.  A box will then pop up that you can type in, and so will a keyboard.  If you're in portrait mode, the keyboard that pops up will be smaller than if you're in landscape mode.They keyboard is much easier to type on than I thought it would be!  I can type almost as fast on it as I can on a physical one.ConclusionI'm not sure how Apple managed to make such a great tablet computer!  One of the things that's great about it is that you can add to the things it can do by getting apps.  Maybe that's one of the keys to it, the iPhone, and the iPod touch's success.  I'm very happy with mine.

I didn't find it appreciably better than my netbook except for size, and it had disadvantages even: no easy way for a non technical person to save photos, incredibly awkward while lying down - which is the way I often use my laptop/netbook, semi reclining.I know there are nice accessories that allowed it to stand up, and accessory keyboards, but in the end I just found it a gimmicky little toy. Reviews.Title: Little trick on installing iBooks and some other iOS 5 apps
Reviews.Author: Vadim
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of complains here about not being able to install many apps on iPad 1st gen. Come on, people, it says in the description - WILL NOT UPDATE PAST iOS 5.1.1!!!! And even though many apps require iOS6 or 7, if you need it just for basic things like internet, mail, eBooks and a few other things like Sudoku or Chess - it works fine.If you have some other things in mind - make sure that it will work for you BEFORE YOU BUY IT! Make sure that the apps you might need will work with iOS5. The rule of thumb - if you need it for more than basics - don;t buy it!It has no camera nor mic, so no pictures/videos taking, no Skype, no audio recording.I bought it for my wife as eReader and even though at first it didn't let me install iBooks (Error: iOS 7 required!) I found a little trick on the internet, how to get the older version:1) install itunes on your PC, download iBooks there, sync iTunes with the iPad.2) disconnect iPad from PC. If you don't see iBooks on your iPad, download it through the AppStore on your iPad - and THEN you will get the message that it requires iOS7 and the option to download older, compatible version of the iBooks.If you just try to install iBooks through the AppStore (without step 1), it won't give you the option of older version, just Error message.People say that this trick can be used to download older versions of some other apps as well (Facebook for inst.), so give it a try.

Reviews.Title: Love my iPad
Reviews.Author: Stephen Ashley "Author of Walt Disney World w...
Reviews.Content: I've had my iPad 1 since it first came out, and I'm still really happy with it. I get so much use out if it, it's become like an appendage. It goes almost everywhere I go. I use it for everything from business to entertainment including email, reading and writing contracts when I'm on the road, watching movies, playing games, reading the news, surfing the web, and for directions and GPS info.There's so much more I use it for as well. There are thousands - maybe hundreds of thousands of apps out there that you can download for free or very inexpensively to do practically anything you can think of. If it isn't created yet, it most likely will be soon.It's easy to use, intuitive, and responsive. The graphics are fantastic, and the touch screen is easy to use. It's light, and small enough to go anywhere with.Personally I needed the 3G, so I can handle business anywhere I am. I also needed the largest memory for my work related activity. It's also good if you'll be watching movies. One reviewer noted that the iPad is slower when you're surfing the web while driving. I'll attest to this. It can be frustrating, but then I remind myself that I'm in a car surfing the web, which is pretty cool to begin with (not while driving, by the way).I did find that if I was doing a lot of typing such as with a business document, typing was too challenging. I purchased a portable keyboard to go with the iPad, and a tiny mouse. Now I can format documents easily.If you're deciding between a first generation and the newer models, here are some thoughts.- Though the first generation iPad is light, the newer iPads are lighter and thinner.- The newer iPads are 4G, and probably faster.- The newer iPads have cameras. This would be a great feature, and it would be nice to be able to make phone face to face calls. Using the camera can be a bit awkward because of the shape and size of the iPad, but it does work.So if you're deciding whether to buy an iPad or not, I would say that it's an amazing product that you'll find tons of uses for, whether it's for business, fun, or practical living.If you're deciding whether to buy an iPad 1 or a newer version, I'd say that this depends on your budget and your specific needs. By buying a first generation iPad, you'll be able to get 64 GB, and 3G at a lower price than with the newer versions.So far, Apple's operating system updates have been working on the first generation iPad, but I've got to wonder if that could change eventually. If you can spring for the newer generations, I'd do that.

Reviews.Author: gianna
Reviews.Content: Provided detailed description with instant communication. Helped with shipping requests and answered all questions. I love my new product!!! !!

Reviews.Title: Apple iPad was a hit!
Reviews.Author: Leslie C. Hull
Reviews.Content: I bought this iPad as an early Christmas present for my daughter.  She loves it!  She uses it for her job as a computer tech constantly with her bosses approval.  The iPad was delivered in a timely fashion and was in the condition advertised.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: lorenza white
Reviews.Content: Product was as described and it was shipped quickly to me. No marks on the screen. I would have gave it a 5 but I didn't like the snap in charger.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: jem kuberski
Reviews.Content: Thanks for a speedy delivery. Product was just as expected. Accurate rating for product. Was given as a gift so it had to be near new. The first gen was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Beanie
Reviews.Content: I bought this to have an additional iPad in the house for when family comes to visit and everyone wants a device (especially the kids). I bought this one used through amazon. Trying to be "green", recycling the device, plus it was purchased for significant less than a new one. I have had no problems buying a used device through amazon. The product arrived quickly, was as or better than described. It has worked perfectly. It was reset to factory settings, so I only had to connect to iTunes and set up as I would a new device. Absolutely no issues. I have purchased other used devices through amazon, and would do so again with confidence.

Reviews.Title: Still using it after 2 years
Reviews.Author: Calvin Young
Reviews.Content: No problems with it slowing down, crashing, not turning on, etc.  Still working well after over 2 years.  We'll probably keep using it until it becomes completely obsolete (no app updates, etc.)  We primarily use it for reading (iBooks, Kindle, Safari), watching TV/Movies (Netflix, ABC, NBC, etc.), and gaming (Zynga).  We occasionally use it for word processing and spreadsheet.  Apps crash occasionally but haven't had major problems.

Reviews.Title: used Ipad
Reviews.Author: suzu
Reviews.Content: the ipad that I bought was used and is exactly what I wanted.  Looks brand new and I love it!

Reviews.Title: Wanted More
Reviews.Author: Shanelle and Danielle
Reviews.Content: Wanted more, teens like music applications that hold lots of music.  I wanted more book choices, as well.  Not many things for me to do with it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Weeble23
Reviews.Content: I love this item. This is without a doubt one of my favorite things. I have owned this now for about 2 years. By this or the new one because, I am just in awe with this item.

Reviews.Title: Great Condition
Reviews.Author: FWh1te
Reviews.Content: The apple iPad first generation is exactly how pamedia outlet described. The ipad came with the charger and looked brand new. The iPad I received has no scratches or scrapes. I have no complaints. None whatsoever!!!!!

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: lacy
Reviews.Content: this is a wonderful pad  everyone in the house using it games our easy to use and travels wellit gets a workout  daily

Reviews.Title: used Ipad 1
Reviews.Author: Eid S. Albuainain
Reviews.Content: the Ipad was good put the charger was not the original one it was duplicated and all other thing was good

Reviews.Title: Recommended
Reviews.Author: alleymarie
Reviews.Content: I got my device way before the date and it was in amazing condition for the price. Only one scratch on the back but i have an Ihome for mine and with any  cover it is not seen.I am extremely happy with my purchase. Recommended. Still great months later.

Reviews.Title: Love Love Love it!
Reviews.Author: Patricia H.
Reviews.Content: We bought an iPad for our teenage daughter and she absolutely loves it.  She uses it non stop everyday!  She uses it for everything from playing games to doing homework.  It's a couple of years old now and it still works perfectly. If hers would have had a camera I would have rated this unit 5 stars. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: vikes fan
Reviews.Content: I have had the first generation Ipad for almost two years now and I absolutely love it.  I got it as a Christmas gift, and at first I really wasn't sure how much I was going to use it being I have a laptop too.  Since I have had my Ipad it has proved to be very useful and handy, and I have used it a lot.  My favorite things about the Ipad are the quick startup, light weight, and general convenience.  I love being able to grab my Ipad, push the home button, and just like that it's on.  It's not like my older laptop which now takes a while to get going.  It's also a lot easier to lie around and surf the web on your tablet than it is on a laptop.  The Ipad is so simple to use and is a fast tablet which I think anyone would enjoy.  If I had any criticisms toward the Ipad it would be the usual criticism of Apple products, which is no flash support.  It's a little annoying to not be able to view the videos you want on a product that is otherwise so great.  There has been some talk of flash possibly being overtaken by the html 5 platform in the future though, so Apple users may win in the end.

Reviews.Title: First experience  with iPad
Reviews.Author: MTC
Reviews.Content: In the beginning I was a little incredulous about the conditions of the used iPad I was buying, but after opening and setting it up it really didn't have a big difference between a new one and the used that I bought. The packing and conditions of the items are excellent. After my first purchase I've being buying like crazy!

Reviews.Title: Auntie M
Reviews.Author: Auntie M
Reviews.Content: IPAD in better condition than described.  Works perfectly. Nephew received as a gift and was immediately put to work. All expectations exceeded with this product.

Reviews.Title: It would be hard to find a better deal
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Rossi
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an e reader because I did not want to spend the amount of money needed for a new Ipad and I was not sure how much I wanted one. Both of my kids kept saying get the Ipad Dad you will enjoy it and it is so easy to operate even you will have no trouble setting it up and using it. When I saw that Amazon had Ipads refurbished at prices better than a cheap Android I thought, Why not give it a try, I have 30 to 60 days to return it and there is so much more I can do with an Ipad. What a great decision. The Ipad I bought from Ocean Electronics looks and operates like it was brand new. Added 14.95 for a new leather cover and I could not be happier. This is a great deal so if your interested in an Ipad and your a beginner like me don't hesitate this is the ticket.

Reviews.Title: Impressions of the Apple iPad One
Reviews.Author: Daniel R. Renninger "Daniel"
Reviews.Content: The Apple iPad 1 is not as independent as its successors (the 2 and the New) so you need a fairly recent Macintosh or Windows computer to set it up. Once set up, you will appreciate the larger, although grainier display than the smaller iPhone and iPod touch. However the larger display means that Everything you do on it is slower than the aforementioned smaller devices, including the original versions.The iPhone and iPod touch come with a number of handy apps that are missing from the iPad 1 (weather, stocks, clock, and voice memos), so you have to hunt for substitutes on the Apple App Store.YouTube works much as it does on any laptop or desktop, that is, somewhat more disorganized, disorderly, and slower than on the iPhone and iPod touch. It does not seem to be capable of streaming video on a full screen so that the user has to switch to a small window to get the video running but it still endlessly halts in the videos. So it will probably be better once Google releases their version of YouTube.The email app takes a very long time to display opened emails. And once you open one, you cannot close it. Rather, you have open the next or previous one. This is extremely annoying, unless your thought processes are as chaotic as the person who designed this app.ITunes works very nicely. It will find your videos on any computer it can detect and will download them automatically. In fact, it works better on the iPad than any other device that iTunes runs on.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: VictorE
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing product! It keeps me entertained for hours. Ill take this over a laptop any day. A little pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: ipad review
Reviews.Author: jhowardsmith
Reviews.Content: We had a problem with the charger and ended up having a third one before we got one that worked. The supplier was very responsive and apologized for the problem which was a company that supplied the chargers to them.

Reviews.Title: very pleased for a used item
Reviews.Author: Matthew Woodbury "matt woodbury"
Reviews.Content: Bought one of the used Ipad 1s from amazon, paid 256$ great price for me to see if I like the whole tablet thing....so far I'm impressed, looking to sell my netbook since this Ipad does it all and better. one issue I had was the included charger...it sucked, luckily I have an Iphone so I can use that charger til I get the dock style charger.but to sum it up....I like what I got, condition was accurate, good with a few use scratches on the back, I've always been impressed by apples products, no wonder they are the most profitable company in the world.

Reviews.Title: APPLE IPAD 1st GEN 32GB,WIFI
Reviews.Author: QCARTER
Reviews.Content: The apple ipad is a very clean, and sleek designed machine!It has multiple features and applications for almost anything!Its fast and very responsive to the touch!Its what I wanted and I am very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Robert Mitchell "fly king"
Reviews.Content: Ipad is in good condition and what I expected.  Had to add chip for wi-fi but 3 g work well in our area.  Happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: iPad
Reviews.Author: Mdeezy
Reviews.Content: It was exactly how the seller described. Brand new out of the box! Perfect condition and factory sealed. This iPad looked like I purchased it straight from the apple store.

Reviews.Title: First purchase on Amazon and beyond happy!
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: Got my iPad today and it was better than described, I am very happy and highly recommend this seller! It was shipped fast and packaged well. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: IPad
Reviews.Author: debjones09
Reviews.Content: The Ipad is great.  Was in the exact condition as specified and arrived as promised.  This is the first time I used Amazon, I will definately shop Amazon again.

Reviews.Title: Laura
Reviews.Author: Lala
Reviews.Content: It was everything promised in the description however i feel it would be better if it did emphasize the fact that it is the i-pad and not the i-pad 2 to avoid disappointment

Reviews.Title: Almost as good as the IPad2
Reviews.Author: J "Wisher"
Reviews.Content: I got an IPad2 and got my husband the IPad 3G. He didn't need video or camera but did need the 3G for trips which will work out GREAT. Haven't used the 3G to much yet.IPad 1st gen. Doesn't get some of the cool apps that have movement but it's pretty good otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: MegaRae "MegaRae"
Reviews.Content: I love my iPAD. Apple products are well designed and this is no different. I will definitely buy the iPAD2 with 3G.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Corinna E. Gandara "alohamama"
Reviews.Content: I received this ipad used, but in great condition. Has made it so much easier for everyone in the family to be online and the apps are great. So portable and handy and user friendly. Love it!!

Reviews.Title: Great I-Pad
Reviews.Author: pat281
Reviews.Content: Had some trouble with Apple initially but problems were resolved.  It was Apple's problem and not Amazons. The I-Pad itself is great and my daughter is enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: I received this iPad as a birthday gift, and couldn't be happier with it!  I don't have a need for cameras, nor does the fact that the iPad 2 is lighter make any difference to me.  I can easily access my email, read my ebooks, store my pictures, and archive/access my recipes.  I am loving it!

Reviews.Title: I-Pad was Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely enjoyed my I Pad; this item was a great find and has exceeded my expectations of what it can do.  I will be purchasing further items from amazon.com to compliment my I-Pad.  The device was a great price in relation to other I-Pads or any other tablets for the size memory it holds, thanks Amazon you came through again.  It was a little scuffed on the edge of the I -Pad, but nothing to noticeable, and it didn't have the charger - still a great product.

Reviews.Title: Flight Guide
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Skagerberg
Reviews.Content: This is to good to be true for flight following. It works GREAT! Plus the added features of Internet, email etc.

Reviews.Title: Great Experience
Reviews.Author: bemichel
Reviews.Content: The iPad was in great shape. There was one minor cosmetic flaw in the metal back of the item, but it functions properly and I planned to cover it with a case anyways. Shipping was unbelievably fast. It came in an entire week before I was expecting it to come it. I got a great deal and it shipped quick - couldn't have asked for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: Just Great....nice if it came with a cover for it.
Reviews.Author: Grace J. Rich
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's birthday gift and I knew he would love it. He uses it all the time. However my only complaint is that I wish it came with at least a standard cover for protection. You feel like the screen can get scratched so easily, and then you have to start shopping for a cover as soon as it comes in....

Reviews.Title: Ipad, first generation
Reviews.Author: Henry H. Graves
Reviews.Content: I received this ipad about a month ago and so far, the experience has been somewhat what i expected.  The 16gbs is enough for me because i already have a zune and an ipod touch to listen to all my music on that.  I use this device to mainly read books, surf the web, and do some email.  I did run into a small problem.  The ipad seems to freeze up when i used email and some web browsing activity.  For the email problem, i simply changed some settings so that when i deleted emails, so that it wouldn't stay on the servers.  As for the web browsing freeze, all i can recommend is to do a hard reset by holding down the hold and home buttons for a few seconds till the apple logo appears.  Also, itunes just sucks, i'm sorry but it just does.  Whenever i tried to sync my podcasts or add videos, it wiped off my data and settings.  I was able to backup my original settings, but i had to sync my data back onto the ipad.  Other than that, this has been an excellent purchase.  I didn't need some of the features of the ipad2 like the dual cameras because that just seemed like a waste and i saved about 100 bucks.  So, it has been worth it and i would do the purchase all over again

Reviews.Title: overall satisfied with this purchase
Reviews.Author: Tereza Volna
Reviews.Content: I was not sure if I should get one as I'm not the biggest Aplle fan (had issues with previous products and really not big on iTunes). I was mosty in need of a reading device as I have most of my reserch material in electronic form and was also considering Kindle for that purpose. I'm glad I decided for iPad after all, will surely use the other additional functions, too. All the issues such as playing different video files etc can be quite easily solved with various apps. The absence of flash can be a pain and I can totally understand someone can be annoyed by this but personally, I didn't experience any major frustration in this matter. I miss easier loading process, direct USB access for easier data flow would be a big plus, I'm really not fan of trasferring everything via iTunes.My other concer was the shape of the item that is sold as refurbished. I have to confirm the iPad arrived very fast, in original packaging and completely unused. works great so overall I can highly recommend this seller, this purchase was a great deal. All in all I can recommend iPad to everyone who seeks for ligth and very user friendly gadger, to ones who travel a lot or need to have their basic computer functions with them all the time. It won't replace your computer but will be fine for most basic interner browsing, watching video, browsing pictures, e-mail, reading etc. Plus you can have a lot of fun with the apps.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Service
Reviews.Author: Rosie
Reviews.Content: The iPad arrived timely and in perfect condition.  It was quick, easy and I love it.  Would definitely use seller again.

Reviews.Title: great Ipad
Reviews.Author: D. Brouillette "db"
Reviews.Content: Great Ipad for a much better price than new.If you don't need 3G or camera's this is it.

Reviews.Title: The benchmark
Reviews.Author: Toolman "A servant"
Reviews.Content: I had an Android tablet first - but Is in a totally different category.  I tried hard to be content - but.......Apple is in a league of it's own.I wish that I had just bitten the cost bullet and started at the top.Absolutely no disappointments.

Reviews.Title: Apple Ipad 64GB WiFi Gen1
Reviews.Author: Connie
Reviews.Content: The Ipad was a great investment. I ordered it used, so the price was more affordable. I added Docs To Go, so I can put Word and Excel documents on it. It allows me to have any document from my desktop right at my fingertips, including PDF files. If I have to talk in front of a group, my notes can be right there as well. My home internet is a Verizon MiFi unit, so I can take the unit with me and have internet wherever I go.I can now listen to music, get my mail from multiple email accounts, read books, sync with my laptop calendar, show phots and I even have my Bible on there. It is like having my desktop with me where ever I go and more.I have my grocery list in ShopShop and my Getting Healthy information in Lose It. With so many Apps it was a great investment.

Reviews.Title: Happy hubbie
Reviews.Author: Maria in Costa Rica
Reviews.Content: My husband is delighted with this I-pad I gave him as birthday present. He is using it several hours a day.I was afraid that, being an "old" model (since it's the first generation), it would not live up to his expectations, but I think it overpassed them.

Reviews.Title: Sold broken IPAD
Reviews.Author: T.J.
Reviews.Content: This IPAD did not work when connecting an external speaker; headphones, speakers... I took to an Apple Service Center and they said it was either a bad Speaker Jack or internal hardware or software problems. This item should not have been sold in it's condition. I tried 2 times to contact the seller and he/she has not responded. I Am Very Upset and hope that Amazon will make things right!

Reviews.Title: The BEST
Reviews.Author: PrettyRed
Reviews.Content: This came quick and it is the BEST!!! I havent put it down since I got it and I saved money! Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great device, but overpriced
Reviews.Author: K. Conroy
Reviews.Content: I much prefer using an iPad to using a netbook or even laptop. The device is small, thin, and lighter than most laptops. A bit awkward to hold and use sometimes, best used on a surface or lap. The touchscreen is very responsive, the user interface is easy to use. It is not so great at creating content such as documents, but it is possible. Better than a smartphone for writing memos and writing/browsing email.Where it really excels is displaying content. Pictures, email, websites, and videos. Using your fingers to scroll or zoom in and out of websites makes it much easier to view than on a netbook or laptop. If you are a Netflix member, the free Netflix app is great. I also really like the free Amazon Kindle app which automatically syncs with your PC, iPhone, Android, iPad, and Kindle of course, but does not require a Kindle to use. There are also many games which work well with the touchscreen, one being Plants Vs Zombies.I really like the iPad and I'm sure the iPad 2 is even better, but with all that said, I think it is over priced. Thankfully I got mine for free from my employer and love it, but I would not buy one.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: V. Goulette "SunsNut"
Reviews.Content: Got an awesome price and lightning fast delivery. I know a lot of people think they're overpriced but I think it's better quality than a lot of the wannabe tablets out there. I don't have to worry about compatibility. Talks to the Macs and even XP computer. The HD games are the bomb, email when I'm out and about is so much easier than my android smartphone. They both get the job done but the bigger screen on the iPad just makes it so much easier. Many of the games I had on my smartphone I've downloaded onto the iPad and wow! The bigger screen again makes the difference. I had bought a cheaper tablet, used it for about 3 days and returned it. Went back to my original philosophy that "If it don't say milk on the carton it's not milk". If you want something that works like an iPad - get an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Some reflections
Reviews.Author: Fredrik Meyer "FredrikM"
Reviews.Content: I bought this mostly for reading PDF-files, but obviously it does much more - and it is really good at it too. The only downside is the screen reflection in sunlight, which makes it literally impossible to read outside on a good day.

Reviews.Title: Great investment
Reviews.Author: Moj43
Reviews.Content: The iPad lives up to the hype. I was a skeptic myself, but after owning apple products the past two years, I knew the company would live up to my expectations.  It is in no way just a large iPhone.I purchased the iPad 32gb wifi version and quickly began loading apps and movies. I also jail broke my version and am writing this review on the iPad itself!So far, I've noticed that the iPad is extremely efficient.The safari pages load quicker than my iPhone 3G and the apps open very fast.The clarity is unbelievable.  I think it's even clearer than my MacBook!The battery life is impressive.  I know it will withstand my 5+ hour flights from Boston to LA.  I watched a two hour movie this evening and played around with it for an additional few hours and my battery is at 56%.I was surprised at how great the volume level actually is. I expected it to not be that great, but when I was watching the movie earlier, I did not use headphones and found the sound quality perfect.  Additionally, the iPad does not emit any noise when processing.Apps:I just dropped a lot of cash on my iPad so I am not willing to spend money on apps yet.  I've explored the free ones exclusively.iBooks has me wowed.  Apple offers an array of free novels to meet anyone's taste.  Classics are my liking and I've loaded at least 15 of them.  You can bookmark your pages and skip chapters or browse.  I was impressed by how easy it is to read on the screen as well. I've never been a fan of reading on a computer, but this app opened my eyes to another world. I like having the ability to change the font size to meet my needs.Bloomberg did a great job of creating an app that offers financial news and personalization. I can track my stocks, track indices, and listen to podcasts.  I can't think of a more informative app out there.Installous. Everything your little hacker heart desires.  If you like installous on your iPhone, you'll appreciate it on your iPad.***********Edit:  Downside found!  Charging this device can be a pain.  I just hooked it up with a USB to my work computer (PC) and, the top right hand corner reads "not charging."  Apple's website states the following:"Some USB 2.0 ports and accessories do not provide enough power to charge iPad. When this occurs the message "Not Charging" appears in the status bar next to the battery icon."Be that as it may, other websites are claiming the Ipad still charges even though the screen states otherwise.  I haven't tested it out myself.  This link provides further details:[...]

Reviews.Title: iPad 16 GB wifi only
Reviews.Author: Mohammad H. Farooqi
Reviews.Content: The iPad 16 gb wifi only is the best value for money in the iPad series. The screen display is absolutely gorgeous as well as the overall finishing quality of the product. Internet browsing, checking multiple mail accounts, watching videos and pictures, listening songs or just spending loads of time playing games and trying out loads n loads of fun filled applications is just an out of this world experience. Ofcourse you can't compare the ipad to a regular pc or a laptop (when it comes to heavy document or graphic processing) but for everything else specially while being on the move there's the iPad.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Product! Better Then Any Netbook!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Winchel
Reviews.Content: I have the 16 GB Wifi iPad, and I absolutely love it! It's amazing what you can do with it! I have photos, music, mucic videos, games, Pages, Keynote, iBooks and more on it, and I still have over 12.5 GB of free space left! It's awesome! A must buy! This is way better then any netbook, and I'm a HP fan! And the volume on here is really awesome too! The only thing that isn't so awesome about the iPad is the price. I think it should be $400.00. But still, don't let the price stop you from owning this amazing device!

Reviews.Title: A small step for man, the leap has yet to come
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have spent more than a week using the iPad and have found many pros and cons which should be considered before purchasing one.Pros: -The opening and closing of applications is very fast making the device very responsive.Watching Youtube video is very much better and clearer than on a PC or iMac.  Sound from the speakers is only OK, however the use of headphones would be recommended. As one who has not the best eyesight, I have found the screen size and quality far superior to that of the iPod or iPhone and a whole lot easier on the eyes.  The visual quality while looking at photos is excellent.  The iPad has freed me to do the basic things I enjoy doing e.g. Facebook & internet browsing without tying up the family's iMac. This has certainly lead to peace of mind in that quarter.Cons: -The device cannot have multiple applications running concurrently, therefore you cannot switch between them with any ease. The lack of Flash support has been somewhat irritating and should be taken into consideration.  As a business tool, the iPad should not be considered a replacement of a notebook or laptop.  A PC, iMac or laptop would be far more preferable.  I have used an app called "DocsAnywhere" and imported files via iTunes, which I found useful.  I was able to review said files while traveling by train to a meeting.  Of course, I also brought my laptop along for the journey.  I would prefer to use the iPad to control syncing with iTunes rather than the other way around, other than having to change the settings in iTunes to forestall this happening. Battery life is as promised although recharging is rather slow while connected to a PC or iMac, however recharging will halt if the parent machine goes into power down mode.Future: -The iPad table may well be the forerunner of a technology which will replace portable computers for business use, but that day is not here yet and will not be for some time to come.Conclusion: -For the casual user, I would say that the device is useful for email, Facebook, Youtube and internet browsing. The screen is brilliant while it is turned on. It is crisp, bright, and very easy to see from any angle, however, when turned off, every finger print and swipe is suddenly very visible. The brightness overcomes this issue while the device is on.  I have certainly enjoyed using the device and will for the foreseeable future.

Reviews.Title: iPad 64gb.... Where have you been all my life!
Reviews.Author: Skyarrow "Mike R."
Reviews.Content: When these first came out, I could not decide if I was going to get one. A friend showed me theirs and I was hooked. Have had mine a few weeks now and have to say I love it. But, I love my iPhone, so why wouldn't I. I really see the iPad as a big iPhone. The only thing that I don't like about my iPhone is the size if the screen... well that has now been taken care of. But there is more... I am finding I can use this in meeting and I don't have to take my laptop in. Reading books is great because they are in color, something my wife's Kindle cannot do. I can watch videos to and from work as I ride the bus. For someone that commutes, this is a dream come true.Now there are issues and a new product like this will always have some. I have not had the issue with the wifi problem. It needs a stylus. I want to be able to write notes and this is not going to happen with my finger. Camera would have been nice and when the multitasking comes around this fall, that will be a nice addition. More drive space or a slot for some kind of memory card should have been there, this is a real issue with me, but other than that, I am very happy and really enjoy my iPad.

Reviews.Title: connectivity
Reviews.Author: college_student
Reviews.Content: I don't understand all the negative reviews commenting on connectivity. My husband has no problem with staying connected with his iPad. I on the other hand cannot keep my less than 3 year old MacBook connected in the same room as his iPad. It is driving me crazy. We are using Airport. I had this problem before the iPad came into the house. Anyway my husband loves his iPad and says there is not one thing he would change about it, at least not now.

Reviews.Title: still basic flaws to fix
Reviews.Author: Prakash Heda "Prakash"
Reviews.Content: Caution: Ipad does not support Video playlist of any kind (music video/ podcast/ tv shows), means you can not configure to play 10 video clips to play one after another(it works just fine on Iphone) which also means when you are playing video forward button will never work...Got it on first day and usually using it every day, have iphone too, other than most of the usual known issues and features here are some which will help you to make a right decision...Ipad is perfect to watch a video...a video looks way better than any laptop you have...Speakers are low yes its true, I was expecting it to be little louder than iphone but it seems its just marginalFlickr/facebook all works so beautifully, this is a perfect device to show your picture portfolioused Slingplayer (iphone edition) and can say it works awesome with dishtv and slingbox solo, very clear...I use google newsreader for news and it works just fine (i dont like other newspaper apps very little content)Calender is looking good though event detail opens in very small screen which means not using the full screen available to display appointment better(iphone does)...appointment forward feature is not supported (iphone has same issue), any link (say for attending webmeeting) is not supported to click, means you have to copy the link test and open in safari to start webmeeting (iphone supports clicking http links directly) last snooze feature is not supported (iphone does not do it either and i hate iphone for not doing it, not sure how many times i missed a meeting because of that)Jump app is perfect for remote desktop...I would say just superb, I usually attend all my web meeting (ofcourse on flash) with that...audio transfer to IPAD works just fine, use it to access all office documents as wellOutlook mails do not get auto refresh, probably to save battery life (bad move from apple and I hate that)Netflix works superb though crash sometimes if you try to move fingers on screen when movie is playingMoving apps from iphone to ipad is breezeyoutube works very fine though playlist is still not supportedI am not looking to get 3G edition cause dont want to be bound by single carrier Reviews.Title: More functionality in my netbook
Reviews.Author: Sally Smith
Reviews.Content: I was totally sold on IPad through the marketting and also the reviews on Amazon. IT REALLY IS LIMITED! I feel cheated. The IPad has a sweet interface and is very simple but it lacks most of the functionality I am used to on my PC. If you are looking at getting an IPad and you use a PC be sure to read all the one star reviews.Instead I bought a netbook (HP Mini) running Windows 7 and it has a built in camera, reliable wireless, and a battery that last several hours. Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Phillip S. Porter
Reviews.Content: I already have an iPad 4, but bought this as a gift for a first time user.  They love it, and use it from early morning to bedtime. Reviews.Content: Though in my golden years, I'm having a lot of fun with my new iPad.  It can be frustrating, but I never give up.  Many problems are not mine. Syncing for one.  I have over 17,000 images on my MacBook Pro and an enormous number of classical music pieces on an extra hardrive.  Naturally I don't want all this on my iPad.
